originalText.text: I suggest this doctor to try himself to snort innocuous substances like Cacao or Matcha and feel the effect on its own nostrils..he will be surprised that our body is very intelligent and knows exactly how to recognize things at "toxic" or "non toxic"

originalText.text:
Dr. Josephson and his team the minute I walked into his office made me feel like I was at home. I am currently a healthcare provider myself and often see smaller acts of kindness do not exist anymore. Dr Josephson and his staff couldn’t be nicer. Scheduling is made easy.  The staff is wonderful and helped me schedule tests to make sure I was able to get in when it was convenient for my schedule. I was given concierge treatment.

I saw multiple Doctors for a mass behind my ear and was told I would need surgery.  Dr.Josephson took the time to treat me and explained that with a longer course of antibiotics I might be able to avoid surgery. He was right. He was very thorough and although I didn’t go to see him about my breathing he found issues and provided me with sprays for my sinuses and my nose. He explained to me that although I was unaware of the breathing problem there was swelling and thus blockage in my nose. Dr Josephson was right and I now breathe much better.  It was nice to see that a doctor took the time and was so thorough.  And he explained everything so that I understood. It all made sense and he made me feel very comfortable.

Dr Josephson went beyond my expectations when he called the pharmacy and my allergist to help me get my prescriptions delivered before my work day was complete and to get appointments before my work day even started. In today’s times when most people don’t even get to see the doctor, instead are treated by the Nurse or PA, that Dr Josephson spent so much time with me. He was very caring. This was very refreshing

After every appointment his staff is always so kind and helpful when booking my next appointments. They are very respectful of my work schedule.

I am truly greatful for Dr Josephson’s expertise and highly recommend him for any of your ENT needs.

originalText.text:
Dr. Josephsen is a miracle worker. I suffered for years with sinus problems until Dr. Josephsen performed an operation that has resulted in vast improvement for over a decade. Originally, he told me that after surgery my polyps could come back neccesitating a return visit to the operating room should I not take care of myself with various medicines and care. Despite this, I have never needed to return to the O.R..
I have been following Dr. Josephson's direction in his book Sinus Relief Now and I have been feeling much better than I ever did with some mild flareups from time to time  much better than I ever thought I'd be.  Very importantly, I did not have to suffer the common post-op "stuffing". He is a very caring and dedicated doctor who is always available for his patients. In fact, he  gives all his patients his personal cell number should they need to reach him for an emergency   I recommend him without reservation and with genuine enthusiasm, respect and admiration.

originalText.text: I have a 12-year-old son named Dominick, who has been debilitated by his sinus problems.  He has suffered from chronic sinus infections and constant congestion for most of his life.   He had terrible debilitating headaches which were affecting his school work.  His other symptoms included constant yellow-green discharge, postnasal drip, sore throat, cough which was keeping him up at night, and hoarseness.  His symptoms would calm down with antibiotics and then flare up when he would go off.   He couldn’t concentrate because of the headaches and cough and his schoolwork was suffering.  We’ve tried so many doctors and allergists, but nothing was working.   He was taking so many different medications.  His sinuses were affecting his daily life at home and at school. He was not himself for years.  At one point, we were told that his only hope for relief would be a major surgery.  Then someone recommended Dr. Jordan Josephson to us as an alternative to the doctors that we were seeing in our hometown.   Dr. Josephson was highly recommended and after seeing him on the first appointment, we left the office feeling as if we have just found our solution to all our son’s congestion issues.  He gave us hope.  Dr. Josephson came up with a course of treatment, arranged for appointments with associates and set us up with an Allergist – all in the same day.  He explained that we needed to take a longer course of medicines which no one before told us.  Months of medicines he said, we would need to be patient and that if we were he would most likely not need surgery.  Who ever heard of a surgeon forgoing surgery.  Well, exactly what Dr Josephson said would happen, happened.  Dominick is now off all of the previous medication he was taking except for a nasal spray.  He is still irrigating with a Grossan Hydropulse and salt water.  Dominick’s headaches are gone.  And he is not coughing anymore.  The improvement is a miracle.   He has started weekly allergy shots for allergies that we didn’t know he had.  And NO Surgery.  We were able to treat his symptoms without having him undergo surgery because Dr. Josephson took the time to treat him with effective medicine and saline rinses.  We were elated to find a surgeon that advocated for us and got us to take a longer course of medicine to obviate the need for surgery.  For the first time in my son’s life, he is feeling better than he has ever felt and as a parent there is no other goal in life.  Dr. Josephson, we are grateful to your staff!! Your staff has been very caring and helpful through this very trying time.  Your colleagues that you sent us gave us VIP treatment and were wonderful.  And most important, thank you, Dr. Josephson, for the wonderful care that you have provided, the time that you spent above and beyond to allay our concerns,  and for getting us to give Dominick the medicines allowing us to forego surgery.  Our son is once again happy and healthy thanks to you.

originalText.text: Dr. Josephson is truly dangerous in my opinion.  I believe that he mislead me into getting endoscopic sinus surgery telling me that it would help with certain unusual problems I was experiencing, without telling me of the incredible pain and risks that it involved.  The surgery resulted in my losing much of my vision. To add to this disaster, although I remember paying Josephson in full, I received a call from debt collectors demanding an additional $25,000 a full three years after the surgery.  I have been hounded by debt collectors since and had my credit rating severely damaged.  In my opinion, this smooth talking menace should be avoided at all cost.  Do not make my mistake.
